text:
I have 3 files available for download (all with same permissions) On the 
directory listing page, only 2 files appear. Files sizes are 33KB, 712000KB and 
2282000KB. The file over 2GB does not appear in the directory listing. When the 
missing file name is entered as part of a URL from the browser, the web server 
returns an error page as follows

*******************************************

Forbidden
You don't have permission to access /lejla/mydocs.zip on this server.

Additionally, a 403 Forbidden error was encountered while trying to use an 
ErrorDocument to handle the request.

Apache/2.0.50 (Unix) Server at terra.uow.edu.au Port 3940

*******************************************************

The file has the same permissions as the other two files, which are download 
sucessfully. So there must be a file size at which this bug is triggered
creator: la@uow.edu.au

text: Larges files are not supported until the Apache httpd 2.1/2.1 releases.
creator: jorton@redhat.com
